cases.title: Conjugation of full-length fibrils
cases.description:
{"blocks":[{"key":"6rbli","text":"Conjugation of full-length fibrils with pHrodo/Alexa dyes/BODIPY-FL NHS ester","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":68,"length":9,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2of78","text":"7 steps","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ln8u","text":"1. Dissolve 100 ug of dye in 50 ul of sterile DMSO (2 mg/mL) 
2. Dilute fibrils to 1mg/mL concentration in PBS containing 0.1M bicarbonate (total volume: 0.95 mL)
3. Add 50 ug of dissolved dye to each reaction tube
4. Incubate overnight in eppendorf tube (foil-wrapped) with continuous shaking
5. In the morning, spin down the dye-fibril solution at 10,000 g for 10 min at 10C
6. Transfer the supernatant and dissolve the pellet with 1 mL of PBS (repeat 5 times)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Image processing
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9pc19","text":"Image alignments and fine alignments were performed prior to the atlas collection. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c5293","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"i065","text":"1. Movie frames were gain-corrected, aligned, and dose-weighed using Relion 4.0 software 46. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fpqkd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"93rp7","text":"2. Contrast transfer function (CTF) parameters were estimated using CTFFIND-4.1 software 47. For helical reconstructions, ~40 images were selected randomly for manual picking and ~14k fragments were extracted with inter-particle distance of 6 β-rungs of 28.5 Å (with estimated helical rise of 4.75 Å) from the start-end coordinate pairs.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ma7d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fkh1k","text":"3. Extracted coordinates were used for training CRYOLO 48. The same model was used for all","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8uv49","text":"image datasets in auto picking mode with CRYOLO. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1bm6a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9rsck","text":"4. Fragments were first extracted using a box size of 1024 pixels and down scaled to 256 pixels resulting in a pixel size of 4.32 Å. Reference-free 2D classifications were performed to assess different fibril strains, cross-over distances (estimated as 1,200 Å), and helical rise (4.82 Å), and to select suitable fragments for further processing. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ftd","text":"5. Initial references were generated from selected 2D class averaged images using","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"65fag","text":"the Relion_helix_inimodel2d command using a cross-over distance of 1200 Å, search shift of 15","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fn9c6","text":"Å, and search angle of 15 degrees. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"373c9","text":"6. The clean set of fragments was re-extracted using box sizes of 512 pixels and down-scaled to 256 pixels (binned pixel size of 2.16 Å) for optimal performance in 3D classifications. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bs8q1","text":"7. To minimize reference bias, initial models were low-pass filtered to 40 Å. 6-8 classes were used during 3D classification together with initial helical twists set to -0.7 degrees, initial helical rises of 4.82 Å, and regularization parameter T of 4. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c4ief","text":"7. Helical symmetry local search was performed with helical twist ranges varying from -0.85 to -0.5 and helical rise ranges varying from 4.8 to 4.84 during classification. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"10f4c","text":"8. Only the central 10% of the z length was used for reconstructions. Classes with nominal folding features were selected individually and re-extracted with box sizes of 384 pixels.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"97fls","text":"9. Additional rounds of 3D classification were performed with the new reconstructions as reference using an initial low-pass filter set to 10 Å to clean the particles further. Classes with the same fibril types and folding features were merged together for 3D auto refinement. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fhpsk","text":"10. Initial helical twist and helical rise parameters were updated from 3D classifications. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d1ji4","text":"11. Local symmetry search was not performed at the first round of refinement. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"24o86","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ttnt","text":"12. In the second round refinement, a shape mask comprising 90% of the central z","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9scca","text":"length was applied along with local symmetry search. To improve the resolution, multiple rounds","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c3b28","text":"of CTF refinement, Bayesian polishing, and refinements with previous results using a particle","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ae8pl","text":"extraction size of 256 pixels were used. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b27rp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ev9t9","text":"13. Post processing was accomplished using a shape mask comprising 10% of the central z length, and final resolutions were estimated for each dataset using the gold standard FSC 0.143 cutoff.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Image processing
Fibril modeling
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7cnqc","text":"Two dimerization related chains from PDB IDs 6SST was used as initial models. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5msqk","text":"Residues fitting model geometries were refined manually using COOT based on each sharpened density map 49. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d6394","text":"Helical symmetry parameters from reconstructions were applied to the templates to generate β-strand stacks with 6 or 7 rungs.
